snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin has sent a military advance team to Syria and is taking other steps that the United States fears could lead Russia to expand its military support for President Bashar al-Assad, administration officials said.
abstract: Obama administration officials express concern over arrival of Russian military advance team in Syria, possible indication Pres Vladimir V Putin is planning expansion of military support for Pres Bashar al-Assad; American intelligence experts say while there is no indication of an intent to deploy ground forces, structures being put in place at Syrian airfield would enable Russia to transport military supplies to Syrian government.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon, and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin has sent a military advance team to Syria and is taking other steps that the United States fears could lead Russia to expand its military support for President Bashar al-Assad, administration officials said.

headline.main: Russian Moves in Syria Pose Concerns for U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russian Moves in Syria Pose Concerns for U.S.
